search_results.snippet: Illustration of a Cartesian coordinate plane. The first value in each ordered pair is the abscissa of the corresponding point. In mathematics, an abscissa (/bss./; plural abscissae or absciss or abscissas) is the number whose absolute value (modulus) is the perpendicular distance of a point from the vertical axis.
